title: Bayern just held meeting with Liverpool target management ; player has  no intention to extend  contract

Bayern Munichâ€™s sporting director, Christoph Freund, is understood to have held a meeting with Jamal Musialaâ€™s management.
Florian Plettenberg reported the update on X amid Liverpoolâ€™s interest in the German international (Football Insider), with the player currently unwilling to extend his terms at the Allianz Arena.

Jamal Musialaâ€™s stance on Liverpool
If one is to take Philipp Kesslerâ€™s reporting on the matter as gospel, Musiala is not considering Anfield as a possible destination as things currently stand.
Thatâ€™s an understandable position to take in light of the project Thomas Tuchel is building in Bavaria, with top striker Harry Kane signed alongside a host of other exciting additions to the squad in the summer window.
Presuming that Bayern can hold out until January for a top holding midfielder â€“ a key requirement for the manager â€“ youâ€™d have to consider the Munich-based outfit a genuine contender for Champions League glory this term.
Thatâ€™s not to suggest Liverpool as an option is a total non-starter in future, with a midfield overhaul completely transforming our fortunes in 2023/24.
We have our own transfer priorities to cater to, of course, which conflict with the need for an attacking midfielder, though itâ€™s difficult to imagine us not being tempted into the market should a player of Musialaâ€™s quality be made available.
